attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description: •    Physical stock counted compared to SAP warehouse inventory balances revealed variances as follows;-  Bread had -61.50 loaves, Utto had +7.243Ltrs, Yeast had -7.029 sachets, while Polybags had +1194 pieces. The rest of the stock items had immaterial variances.
attributes.recommendation:
•    Stock controls should be enhanced to minimize variances noted.
•    Bread variance noted should be recovered from the person responsible.
attributes.effect: •    Stock variations is indication of weak stock controls in place, improvement is required to caution the company from losses associated with stock mismanagement.

value:
•    Bread shortfall noted was recovered.
•    We will tighten our controls to eliminate the variances noted.
•    We shall ensure the controls are enhanced to control stock variations, the bread shortfall noted was recovered.

•    Stock take was conducted on 16th May 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.
•    Stock variations is indication of weak stock controls in place, improvement is required to caution the company from losses associated with stock mismanagement.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure stock items are properly controlled and accounted for

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description: •    From the samples picked, bread underweight were noted across all varieties as illustrated below.
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch management should tighten production controls to ensure all finished products meets the minimum weight standard.
attributes.effect:
•    Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to the risk of regulatory penalties if caught by Weights and Measures officials in the market.
•    Supplying underweight bread may lead to consumer dissatisfaction.

value: •    Some underweight are attributed to overcooling. We shall task our supervisor to ensure production and slicing standards are adhered to.
•    We shall be conducting spot checks to ensure we comply with the weight standards.

•    Bread weight check was done from a sample selected from packed bread ready to be dispatched to the market. The aim was to establish whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.

•    Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to the risk of regulatory penalties if caught by Weights and Measures officials in the market.
•    Supplying underweight bread may lead to consumer dissatisfaction.
Operations/Production Department
The aim was to establish whether the bread dispatched to the market meets the required weight standards.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that production damages were averaging at 0.24% of the total production and market damages stood at 0.41% of the total sales. 

Production and Market Damages Analysis
attributes.recommendation: •    The branch management should closely monitor the production process to control damages and ensure they remain at acceptable levels

value: •    We are working hard to ensure production related damages are managed.
•    I am closely working with the branch team to ensure we manage production damages to the acceptable levels.

•    Analysis of production and market damages was done for a period of 31 days from 15th April 2025 to 15th May 2025 to determine whether production and market damages were within the desired percentages of 0.20% of the total production and 0.50% of the total sales respectively.
•    Production damages recorded exceeded the acceptable level of 0.2% which implies there was a revenue forfeiture of Kshs. 18,762
Operations/Production Department
To determine whether production and market damages were within the desired percentages of 0.20% of the total production and 0.50% of the total sales respectively.

attributes.title: Mixing Charts Analysis
attributes.description:
•    Below is a summary of physical mixing data collected compared to SAP mixing chart summary for the period;

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

•    It was noted that, Average production was 149.90 bags per day, which is 77% of the daily target of 195 bags. Yield achieved during the period was 190.38

•    The table below shows summarized findings on production analysis.
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch should continue to adhere with production standards and also take advantage of the available production capacity whenever the need arises.
attributes.effect:
•    The branch's production capacity utilization was at 77% of the available capacity. This indicates that the branch did not fully capitalize on economies of scale.
•    Production data was accurately captured in SAP

value: •    Production target shortfall is majorly due to shifts cuts guided by market demand and transfers requests.
•    We plan our production based on orders and transfers requests.

•    In the previous audit, it was noted that average production was 131.16 bags per day, which is 67% of the daily target of 195 bags. Yield achieved during the period was 190.33. Data transferred from the physical mixing charts to the cash flow and SAP was accurate.

•    An analysis of mixing chart summaries was done for a period of 31 days from 15th April 2025 to 15th May 2025, to confirm production data accuracy from mixing charts to cash flow, SAP, raw materials usage as per the set BOM, production yield and if the set production standards were achieved.

•    The branch's production capacity utilization was at 77% of the available capacity. This indicates that the branch did not fully capitalize on economies of scale.
•    Production data was accurately captured in SAP
Operations/Production Department
To confirm production data accuracy from mixing charts to cash flow, SAP, raw materials usage as per the set BOM, production yield and if the set production standards were achieved.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
•    Cash counted compared to cash flow balance had Kshs +1 variation. 
•    There were three pending IOU’s amounting to Kes. 8,000 as illustrated below
attributes.recommendation:
•    The branch cashier should maintain the cash controls in place.
•    The timelines for IOU clearance should be adhered to.
attributes.effect:
•    Minimal cash variance implies that adequate cash controls are in place.
•    One pending IOU of Kshs. 5,000 issued to Meshack Khisa on 30th March 2025 violate the company rule on the number of days for IOU clearance.

value: •    This is well noted

•    Cash is well maintained.
•    I will follow up the pending IOUs clearance.
•    In the previous audit, Cash counted compared to cash flow balance had a minimal variance of Kshs. +2
•    Verification of cash held at the cash office on 19th May 2025, to confirm cash held by the cashier matches the expected cash and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to.

•    Minimal cash variance implies that adequate cash controls are in place.
•    One pending IOU of Kshs. 5,000 issued to Meshack Khisa on 30th March 2025 violate the company rule on the number of days for IOU clearance.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that company cash is not misappropriated.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that, the total outstanding debtors amounted to Kshs 2,194,429.85. Outstanding balances relating to Institution amounted to Kshs 1,807,906. Representing 82% of the total branch debtors. Outstanding balances for inactive customers without security amount to Kshs. 261,595

Debtors Analysis
attributes.recommendation:
•    Branch management to ensure that bread supplied is paid for on delivery for customers without credit arrangement.
•    Follow up on institutions payments on time by the sales rep.
attributes.effect: •    Outstanding route balances for customers without security may result in bad debts, leading to financial losses.

value: •    Invoicing is currently guided by the customer payments and security balance to reduce exposure.
•    Institution balances are closely monitored to ensure that their balances remain at manageable levels.

•    In the previous audit, it was noted that, the total outstanding debtors amounted to Kshs 2,799,928. It was further noted that one active institution (Kapenguria Boys high school) had Kshs. 1,588,125 which was 57% of the total outstanding balances.
•    An analysis of the route balances was done as at 17th May 2025 to ascertain the branch accounts receivables status thereof.
•    Outstanding route balances for customers without security may result in bad debts, leading to financial losses.
Sales Department
To assess the level of exposure to the company through customer balances

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that the production efficiency for the period was 4.46 bags per production worker. 

Illustration of Production efficiency analysis
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch management should aim to achieve 100% efficiency to prevent incurring unbudgeted labour costs.
attributes.effect: •    Efficiency shortfall implies that the company spent unbudgeted production labour costs amounting to Kshs. 11,743.95

value: •    We shall ensure we continue to manage our workers efficiently.
•    The efficiency achieved is good and the slight failure to achieve 100% is attributed to shift cuts.
•    In the prior audit, it was noted that the production efficiency was 4.47 bags per production worker.

•    Production efficiency was calculated for period of 31 days from 15th April 2025 to 15th May 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired achieved the standard production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.
•    Efficiency shortfall implies that the company spent unbudgeted production labour costs amounting to Kshs. 11,743.95
Operations/Production Department
To determine if the production workers hired achieved the standard production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency
attributes.description: •    Analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 95.60 crates per slicer.
attributes.recommendation: •    Branch management should ensure packers hired are well controlled to eliminate inefficiency.
attributes.effect: The inefficiency resulted to a cost implication of Kshs. 8,208

value: •    We shall continue to supervise and monitor our slicers to ensure the set standard is achieved.
•    We have seen some improvement, Assessment of the workload to determine the number of packing workers hired and supervision to ensure they achieve the set standard shall continue.
•    In the prior audit, analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 91.23 crates per slicer.
•    Slicing efficiency was calculated over a 31-day period, from 15th April 2025, to 15th May 2025, to determine whether the KPI of 97 crates per slicer was being met.
•    Packing workers failed to achieve the set efficiency of 97 crates per worker. The inefficiency resulted to a cost implication of Kshs. 8,208
Operations/Production Department
To determine whether the KPI of 97 crates per slicer was being met.

attributes.title: Motor Vehicle Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
•    It was noted that; Chepareria, Ortum and Bread transfer assigned vehicles were saving on fuel consumption while the rest were consuming as per the set standards with minimal variations.
•    It was further noted that vehicle KDB 288W, assigned to the Lodwar route, was not included in the fleet records for fuel consumption monitoring.
•    Mileage analysis illustration table is annexed below.
attributes.recommendation: •    Fuel consumption controls should be maintained to caution the company against unbudgeted fuel expenses.
attributes.effect: •    Minimal variations is an indication of efficient fuel consumption monitoring

value: •    Fuel consumption monitoring shall be maintained.
•    To be maintained.
•    In the prior audit, Fuel consumption was within the set standards.
•    Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis was done for the period 1st May 2025 to 16th May 2025, to evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
•    Minimal variations is an indication of efficient fuel consumption monitoring.
Transport/Fleet Department
To evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
